meanings.definition: To lift or throw with a pitchfork.
meanings.sent1: He pitchforked the hay into the loft.
meanings.sent2: The farmer pitchforked the pile of leaves into the compost bin.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel pitchforked the acorns into the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her words pitchforked me into a state of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The chef pitchforked the spaghetti onto the plate with precision.

meanings.definition: To thrust or impale with a pitchfork.
meanings.sent1: The gardener pitchforked the soil to aerate it.
meanings.sent2: He pitchforked the stack of hay bales onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The magician pitchforked the playing card into the watermelon.
meanings.sent4: His accusation pitchforked her heart with guilt.
meanings.sent5: The knight pitchforked his enemy with his weapon.
